speed_limits.notes: Varies wildly by state. Freeway limits range from 65 to 85 mph. Watch signs.

alcohol_limit.notes: Stricter (0.04% or less) for commercial drivers. Open container laws are strict.

rules.seatbelt_rules: Mandatory in almost all states (Click it or Ticket).
rules.child_seat_rules: State laws vary but generally <8 years/booster seat required.
rules.phone_usage_rules: Texting banned in 48 states. Hands-free laws vary (many states ban holding phone).
rules.headlights_rules: Sunset to Sunrise. Wipers On = Lights On (in most states).
rules.priority_rules: 4-Way Stop: First to stop = First to go. If unclear, yield to right. Yellow school bus flashing = STOP.

tolls.notes: Turnpikes in East/Midwest. Bridges/Tunnels in NYC/SF. Plate readers or E-ZPass often used.

rules.parking_rules: Red curb = Fire lane. Colored curbs mean restrictions. Park in direction of travel.
rules.winter_rules: Tire chains required in Rockies/Sierra Nevada passes during storms.

summary: Rules are state-based but generally consistent. 'Right on Red' is standard (stop first) unless signed otherwise. Stop signs are meant literally. Do not pass stopped school buses.
common_traps: Passing a school bus with lights flashing (Critical offense).
Move Over Law: You must change lanes for stopped emergency/service vehicles.
rental_and_idp_notes: Credit card usually mandatory. Under 25 fee applies. IDP recommended for non-English licenses.

differences.phone_usage_rules: Strict hands-free. Phone must be mounted.

regional_variations.notes: Lane splitting by motorcycles is legal. immense traffic in LA/SF.

differences.priority_rules: NO Right on Red in NYC limits unless sign permits.

regional_variations.notes: Don't drive in Manhattan if you can avoid it. Expensive tolls and parking.
Headlights must be on if it is raining. Move Over law strictly enforced.
